item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver arrived at disposal facility an upon opening the trailer doors, found that 1 x 55 gallon poly drum had fallen from the pallet and was on its side and was leaking from one of the top bungs. Driver notified disposal facility personnel, the drum was up righted and leaking stopped. Disposal facility crew cleaned up the spillage in the trailer and in the parking lot.

item.title: Report E-2024060066
item.description:
Report E-2024060066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of material released from one (10 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were recovered and containerized into three (3) 10-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060132
item.description:
Report E-2024060132

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of nitric acid was compromised and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE deployed absorbent pads to the top of the drum. The crew collected the spent absorbents into one (1) 10-gallon bucket for disposal. FCE removed the compromised drum from the trailer and placed it into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060131
item.description:
Report E-2024060131

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 30-gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES placed the damaged drum into one (1) 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and the asphalt parking lot. ES collected the spent absorbents and debris into four (4) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024060135
item.description:
Report E-2024060135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1760-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, the damaged drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2024060046
item.description:
Report E-2024060046

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted concrete dock. FCE utilized hand tools to collect the released material and neutralizer into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the plastic shrink wrap, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060148
item.description:
Report E-2024060148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that two (2) 5-gallon poly drums containing UN1263, Fast Dry Gray Epoxy Primer released approximately 6-gallons in total onto the trailer floor due to improper loading. The spill was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill and containerizing the waste into a 65-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060072
item.description:
Report E-2024060072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1760 Reverse-A-Crete release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-ounces of product released to the drum lid only. The drum was wiped down and placed into an 85-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbent pads and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the drum that arrived leaking, approximately 2.5-gallons of BYK-W 996 (hazardous - UN1993) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri will be placed into a 65 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024060076
item.description:
Report E-2024060076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 53ft-by-8ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that forty (4) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon plastic drum. Hepaco personnel used water to gather the released material and then deployed a granular absorbent to the impacted areas. The spent absorbents were gathered and containerized along with impacted debris into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The damage drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060008
item.description:
Report E-2024060008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: BERLIN HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver notice liquid escaping from trailer on 4/29/2024 and he pulled over on the shoulder and proceeded to put down absorbents to create a dam preventing it from spreading further. He then called our emergency response number and 911 approximately 1825 CT. Local fire showed up and a container was put under the valve that was leaking. Federal, State, and Local EPS agency's were notified ant approximately 1845 CT We dispatched a team to the scene they arrived at approximately 2130 CT. They spoke with the local EPA that was on scene and then began clean up. The clean up was completed at approximately 1700 CT 4/30/2024.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Minibulk driver was scheduled to get loaded at PVS Nolwood Painesville, OH with a shipment of Sodium Hydroxide 50%. During the loading process approximately 100 gallons overfilled the tanker-trailer. The driver noticed product was released from the compartment and notified the plant, which shut down the flow.
